panel.field: Replaces NPC190 "Surface Robot" Adds moving platforms as NPCs that Quote can stand on, and jump through from below.
Uses customizable areas of the tileset as its sprite, and can move in virtually any direction/angle and speed desired. NOTE: The sprite of the NPC should be set to 02-"Current Map Tileset".

The flag 0x0400, if set, causes the platform to fall when the player steps on it, and additionally if the flag 0x1000 is set, the fallen platform will then begin to float on any water blocks/water level. Flag 0x2000 will make the platform spawn 0.5 tiles lower.
The lower byte in the flag ID represents the position in the tileset the platform will use for its sprite. Use multiple platform NPCs to create a larger platform than 1 tile.

The higher byte in the flag ID is used for the angle of movement. As the way bytes are stored, valid angles are always 256 apart, with 32 valid angles across the circle. so the first valid angle besides [+0] is [+256] at 5.625 degrees, and the next is [+512] at 11.25 degrees, then [+768] at 16.875.

The lower nibble in the event num is multiplied by 8, then used for the delay for when the platform reverses its movement direction, once it has reached max speed. Should be a value between 0 and 15. The higher nibble in the event num is used for the max speed of the platform. This can stay as [+16], [+32], [+64] etc. This should be a value between 0 and 15, multiplied by 16.
The higher byte in the event num is used for the acceleration of the platform. A value between 0 and 32, multiplied by 256.

The 0x1000 flag on a moving platform should reverse the initial direction of movement, potentially making things less messy. If you want diagonal angles, up-left is [+2048], up-right is [+6144]. The angle should be a value between 0 and 32, multiplied by 256. Basically, say you wanted a platform that moves at an angle of 45 degrees True (translating to angle [24*256 = 6144]), and the sprite of the 173rd tile in the tileset, you'd have a flagID of 6144 + 173 = 6317. For example, if you want it to move to the left leave the flag ID as the tile number [+0]. If you want it to, say, move upwards, add [+4096] (90 degrees) to the tile number. Example: A platform with an acceleration of 2, a max speed of 5 and a slowdown delay of 12 will have an eventnum of (2x256) + (5x16) + 12 = 604. The smallest possible movement distance (besides 0) is 272, with 1 acceleration, 1 max speed and 0 delay.
